### Random Theme Selector

> Want to surprise your users? Use the **`random`** theme to automatically pick a different theme each time!

- [Random 404](fairer-pages/random/404.html) - Randomly selects from all available themes
- Works with any error code: [Random 500](fairer-pages/random/500.html), [Random 403](fairer-pages/random/403.html), etc.
- Perfect for keeping error pages fresh and unexpected

# Available Themes (64)

All themes support **all HTTP 4xx and 5xx error codes dynamically!** Each theme uses a single dynamic error page that automatically displays the correct error code and message for any HTTP error (400-599).

> Note: The Preview links below are **only functional from the WebUI of the docker container**. There's a method to the madness, I promise.

## Adding More Themes

### The Easy Way — CSS + JSON (Recommended)

Most themes are just **two files** and the shared template handles everything else. No HTML to write!

1. Create a new directory: `src/themes/my-cool-theme/`
2. Add a `theme.json` with your theme's personality:
```json
{
    "layout": "card-image",
    "name": "My Cool Theme",
    "image": "resources/cool-pic.png",
    "imageAlt": "Something cool",
    "fonts": "https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Your+Font&display=swap",
    "buttons": {
        "home": "Go Home",
        "back": "Go Back"
    },
    "titles": {
        "404": "Lost in the Sauce",
        "500": "It Broke",
        "default": "Oops"
    },
    "messages": {
        "404": "We couldn't find that page anywhere.",
        "default": "Something went sideways."
    }
}
```
3. Add a `theme.css` to style it — override any `--fp-*` CSS custom properties from `base-layouts.css`:
```css
:root {
    --fp-bg: #1a1a2e;
    --fp-card-bg: rgba(30, 30, 50, 0.95);
    --fp-text: #eee;
    --fp-accent: #e94560;
    --fp-code-color: #e94560;
    --fp-font-body: 'Your Font', sans-serif;
    --fp-card-radius: 20px;
    /* ... override whatever you want */
}
```
4. Drop any images/gifs in `src/themes/my-cool-theme/resources/`
5. Build and see it live!

> **Layouts:** Set `"layout"` in your theme.json to `"card"` (no image), `"card-bg"` (fullscreen background image with card overlay), or `"card-image"` (image inside the card). Check `base-layouts.css` for all the `--fp-*` properties you can override.

> **Flavor text:** All string fields in theme.json are optional. You can define per-error-code text for `titles`, `messages`, `descriptions`, and `footers` — or just set a `"default"` and call it a day.

### The Custom Way — Full HTML

Want to go off-script? Build something the template can't do? Just drop an `error.html` in your theme directory and it takes priority over the shared template. The outlier themes (venn-diagram, control-room, xbox-bootup, etc.) use this approach for layouts that are too unique for the template system.

1. Create `src/themes/my-wild-theme/error.html`
2. Handle error code parsing, goBack(), resource paths — all in your file
3. The shared template is bypassed entirely for your theme

> Look at `src/themes/back2thefuture/error.html` or `src/themes/venn-diagram/error.html` for examples of fully custom themes.
